result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges.  To be paid by 8/14/15. If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M Barnett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of PLEA & SENTENCING transcript commencing JUNE 15, 2015, received and filed. (27 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REQUIRED BY STATUTE

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant David M Barnett not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant David M Barnett not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial date is vacated defendant wishes to enter a plea.  Case adjourned for a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant David M Barnett not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5.7.15 and for jury trial on 6.3.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING  proceedings commencing FEBRUARY 24, 2015 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to VINCENT GUIMONT, 819 N 6TH, 9TH FL, MILWAUKEE, WI 53203, PUBLIC DEFENDER.kl

Defendant David M Barnett in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David M Barnett in custody.  Ron Dague for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06JV1479A that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION AUTHORIZING BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David M Barnett in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David M Barnett in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
